Content:
Import License
Customs may require an import license for certain products depending on their harmonized tariff code and country of origin. The importer must obtain this.
Declaration of Conformity
For CE-marked goods (e.g., toys, medical devices), a Declaration of Conformity is needed to prove EU safety standards. Issued by the manufacturer or EU representative.
Free Trade Agreements
Preferential duty rates apply if goods meet origin rules—proof via a certificate or exporter statement.
Import Control System 2 (ICS2)
Since March 1, 2023, air shipments to/via the EU (including Netherlands) need a 6-digit HS code, detailed descriptions, and consignee’s EORI number.
Certificate of Origin
Not mandatory for textiles but must state origin on the invoice. Customs may request a certificate if doubtful.
MSDS-NON DG
IATA A67 goods (e.g., batteries) need an MSDS—UAE transits may delay without it.
Info About Section Header: This section explains the paperwork needed when bringing goods into the Netherlands, including certificates, permits, and other requirements.
Simplified Form: - *Import License*: Some goods need a license based on their origin and HS code—importer must arrange it.
- *CE Marking*: For toys, medical devices, etc., include a Declaration of Conformity to meet EU safety rules.
- *Trade Agreements*: Lower duties possible—show proof of origin with a certificate or statement.
- *ICS2 Rules*: Air shipments to/via Netherlands since March 2023 need a 6-digit HS code, clear item details, and consignee’s EORI number.
- *Origin on Invoice*: Textiles don’t need a certificate, but list the origin country per item—Customs might ask for more proof.
- *MSDS for Safety*: Shipping batteries? Attach an MSDS, especially if going through UAE, to avoid delays.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
UPS cannot deliver to P.O. Boxes—full street address and phone number required.
Duty and Taxes
Include freight and fees in value calculations for duties/taxes.
Gifts & Samples
Since December 2019, gifts to India attract duties/taxes regardless of value.
Info About Section Header: This section provides details on the rules and processes for getting shipments through customs in the Netherlands, including addresses and contact info requirements.
Simplified Form: - *No P.O. Boxes*: Give a full street address and phone number—P.O. Boxes don’t work.
- *Duty & Tax Costs*: Add shipping fees to the item value when figuring out duties/taxes.
- *Gifts to India*: Note—gifts to India (not Netherlands) face duties/taxes since Dec 2019.

Content:
Service covers every address in the Netherlands.
UPS cannot deliver to P.O. Boxes—full address required.
Rest Days: Saturday, Sunday, and official holidays.
GMT: Spring +0200 / Fall +0100
Language: Dutch
Currency: Euro (EUR)
Info About Section Header: This section lists the locations where shipping services are available in the Netherlands, along with time zones and holidays.
Simplified Form: - *Full Coverage*: UPS delivers to every address in the Netherlands.
- *No P.O. Boxes*: Provide a complete street address with phone number.
- *Closed Days*: No delivery on Saturday, Sunday, or Dutch holidays.
- *Time Zone*: Spring GMT +0200, Fall GMT +0100.
- *Language & Currency*: Dutch is spoken; payments in Euros (EUR).

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—third-party name, country, and account number needed. Surcharge if billed outside Netherlands.
Payment Methods
Only shipper can pay by card, check, or cash.
Split Duty And VAT (SDV)
Freight/duties to shipper/third party, taxes to receiver/third party—surcharge applies.
Third-Party Billing
Domestic shipments can’t bill third parties outside the EU unless payor has a VAT/Tax ID.
Info About Section Header: This section explains how shipping costs, duties, and taxes can be paid and by whom in the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Who Pays*: Duties/taxes can go to shipper, receiver, or third party—include third-party details.
- *Extra Fee*: Billing duties/taxes outside Netherlands adds a surcharge.
- *Cash/Card*: Only the shipper can pay with card, check, or cash.
- *Split Billing*: Freight/duties to one party, taxes to another—expect a surcharge.
- *Third-Party Rule*: Netherlands-to-Netherlands shipments can’t bill outside EU unless the payor has a VAT ID.

Content:
Samples
Must be for business use, marked/mutilated, and described fully on the invoice.
Shoes
Detailed info (leather type, sole material, shoe type) required.
Antiques
Over 100 years old get 0% duty and reduced VAT—expert confirmation needed.
Animal Products
Need vet inspection and ISC contract—specific docs for food/non-food items.
Dairy
Treated as animal products—vet checks apply.
Artwork
Originals import at 0% duty and reduced VAT.
Honey
Check EU import bans—needs health certificate and vet check.
Info About Section Header: This section lists special rules for shipping certain types of goods to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Samples*: For business only—mark them unusable and detail on the invoice.
- *Shoes*: List leather type, sole material, and who they’re for (e.g., men’s boots).
- *Antiques*: Over 100 years? Get 0% duty and lower VAT with expert proof.
- *Animal Products*: Need vet checks and an ISC contract—extra docs for food or non-food.
- *Dairy*: Counts as animal products—vet inspection required.
- *Artwork*: Original paintings or sculptures get 0% duty and reduced VAT.
- *Honey*: Confirm it’s allowed (some origins banned)—include a health certificate and expect a vet check.

Content:
Shipment value: 45 EUR
Type: Individual-to-individual
Rule: Per person
Limits: 50 cigarettes, 1L spirits (>22% vol), 2L wine, 50g perfume. Mark 'gift' on invoice and waybill.
Info About Section Header: This section explains if gifts can avoid taxes or duties and lists items that can’t be sent as gifts to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Gift Limit*: Up to 45 EUR per person avoids duties/taxes.
- *Allowed Items*: 50 cigarettes, 1L strong spirits, 2L wine, 50g perfume max.
- *Label It*: Write 'gift' on the invoice and UPS waybill, plus the giver’s name and address.

Content:
Non-document shipments need 1 original + 2 copies of the invoice. Documents don’t need one.
Consignee’s phone required for private shipments over 22 EUR.
Avoid vague descriptions (e.g., 'apparel'—use 'men’s shirts').
Info About Section Header: This section details what information must be included on an invoice for shipping goods to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Invoice Copies*: Non-documents need 1 original and 2 copies—documents skip this.
- *Phone Number*: Add consignee’s phone for private shipments over 22 EUR.
- *Clear Details*: No vague terms—say 'women’s jackets,' not 'apparel'.

Content: No commercial value items like airline tickets, annual reports, passports, etc., count as documents.
Info About Section Header: This section lists items that are treated as documents (not goods) for shipping purposes to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Documents Only*: Tickets, passports, reports—no value? No invoice needed.
- *Mark It*: Check 'Documents Only' on the waybill.

Content:
Prohibited: Seeds, plants from India, personal effects, vitamins with certain substances.
Restricted: Alcohol (ISC contract only), tobacco (needs Dutch excise labels), wine (extra docs).
Info About Section Header: This section lists items that cannot be shipped to the Netherlands or have strict rules.
Simplified Form: - *Banned*: No seeds, Indian plants, personal effects, or vitamins with melatonin.
- *Alcohol*: Only with an ISC contract—duty paid at entry.
- *Tobacco*: Must have Dutch excise labels or it’s seized.
- *Wine*: Needs a certificate and analysis report unless under 5L.

Content:
Saturday Delivery Available: Yes
Available in some areas—check UPS transit system.
Info About Section Header: This section provides info wherther saturday delivery is available in the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Saturday Option*: Possible in some Netherlands areas—verify with UPS transit system.

Content: India to Netherlands: Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, Express.
Info About Section Header: This section lists the types of shipping services available from India to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *India to Netherlands*: Choose Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, or Express—check UPS for availability.

Content:
Temporary Import
Goods for exhibits/testing clear without duty/VAT if re-exported—security deposit required.
Samples
Must be marked/mutilated and described.
Embassy Shipments
Tax/duty-free with a 'libre permis' form from the embassy.
Info About Section Header: This section covers unique rules for temporary imports, repairs, or specific materials to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Temporary Imports*: For shows or tests—no duty/VAT if re-exported, but pay a deposit first.
- *Samples*: Mark them unusable and detail on the invoice.
- *Embassy Goods*: Duty-free with a 'libre permis' form—shipments wait until it’s provided.

Content:
Deminimis: 150 EUR—duty-free but VAT applies above 22 EUR.
Exports over $1,000 USD need formal clearance.
Info About Section Header: This section states the minimum value thresholds for shipments that affect taxes or duties in the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Low Value*: Up to 150 EUR skips duty, but VAT kicks in above 22 EUR.
- *High Value Exports*: Over $1,000 USD needs formal export clearance from India.

Content:
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs.) per package.
Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in.).
Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in.) length and girth combined.
Info About Section Header: This section specifies the maximum weight and size allowed for packages to the Netherlands.
Simplified Form: - *Weight Limit*: 70 kg (150 lbs.) max per package.
- *Size Limits*: Max length 274 cm (107.9 in.), total length + girth 400 cm (157.5 in.).
